com.snakk.advertising
Interface SnakkAdPrompt

public interface SnakkAdPrompt

AdPrompts are a simple ad unit designed to have a native feel. The user is given the option to download an app, and if they accept, they are taken to the app within the app marketplace.

Simple example:

 SnakkAdPrompt adPrompt = SnakkAdvertising.getAdPromptForZone(context, "YOUR_ZONE_ID");
 adPrompt.show(); // AdPrompt is loaded and shown asynchronously
Instances of SnakkAdPrompt are not safe for use by multiple threads.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SnakkAdPrompt.SnakkAdPromptListener
          Implement this interface to be notified of AdPrompt lifecycle changes.

Method Detail

getListener

SnakkAdPrompt.SnakkAdPromptListener getListener()
Returns:
the listener instance that will be notified of ad lifecycle events

setListener

void setListener(SnakkAdPrompt.SnakkAdPromptListener adPromptListener)
Parameters:
adPromptListener - the listener instance that will be notified of ad lifecycle events

isLoaded

boolean isLoaded()
Returns:
true if ad is ready for display onscreen, false otherwise

load

void load()
Fire off an asynchronous request to server for an AdPrompt. Use SnakkAdPrompt.SnakkAdPromptListener or isLoaded() to determine when AdPrompt is loaded.

show

void show()
Display AdPrompt to user. If AdPrompt is not loaded, load() will be called and the AdPrompt will be loaded and shown asynchronously. Use SnakkAdPrompt.SnakkAdPromptListener or isLoaded() to determine when AdPrompt is loaded.
